result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:18 PM Defendant Heather M Miller in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin.

The State requests the Defendant appear in person.
The Court grants the request and the Defendant to appear in person at the next court date.

records.addlTxt: Court record text sealed by Judge Carter
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Carter on 09/16/2022.

Notice Regarding United States Passport for Criminal Defendant
The original document was titled: Notice Regarding United States Passport for Criminal Defendant
The original history event date is: 09-15-2022
**DEF STATES SHE DOES NOT HAVE A PASSPORT** jmb
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18, with the exception of her own child.  Defendant is not to work in any child care setting.  Defendant to have no contact with the Lawrence School or any employee or past employee of the Lawrence School/any parent of a student at the Lawrence School/Victims/Witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  If defendant has a passport, they are to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant states they do not have a passport.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

2:01 PM Defendant Heather M Miller in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Heather M Miller.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State is in compliance with victims rights in this matter.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney.  Attorney Gutierrez states they will re-evaluate the defendant.  The Court further provides the defendant with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Court sets a status of counsel date for Monday.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
